gurmukhi: ਅਧ ਰਾਤ ਦੱਤ ਨਿਹਾਰ || ਗੁਣਵੰਤ ਬਿਕ੍ਰਮ ਅਪਾਰ || ਜਲ ਮੁਸਲਧਾਰ ਪਰੰਤ || ਨਿਜ ਨੈਨ ਦੇਖ ਮਹੰਤ ੨੭੩ ||
transliteration: Avilok Soubhrit Ek|| Goun Maddh(i) Jaas Anek|| Adh Raat Thaadh Duaar|| Nij Nain Dekh Mahant||273||
translation: Dutt saw that Vikram-like individual full of qualities at midnight and he also saw that it was greatly pleased in his mind.273.

gurmukhi: ੲਿਕ ਚਿੱਤ ਠਾਢਹੁ ਅੈਸ || ਸੋਵਰਨ ਮੂਰਤ ਜੈਸ || ਦ੍ਰਿੜ ਦੇਖ ਤਾ ਕੀ ਮੱਤਿ || ਅਤਿ ਮਨਹਿ ਰੀਝੇ ਦੱਤ ||੨੭੪||
transliteration: Ik Chitt Thaadhoh Ais|| Sovaran Moondat Jais|| Drid Dekh Taa Kimatt(i)|| At(i) Manah(i) Reejhe Datt||274||
translation: He seemed standing like a golden statue single-mindedly; Seeing his concerntration, Dutt was greatly pleased in his mind. 274.

gurmukhi: ਨਹੀ ਸੀਤ ਮਾਨਤ ਘਾਮ || ਨਹੀ ਚਿਤ ਲਯਾਵਤ ਛਾਮ || ਨਹੀ ਨੈਕ ਮੋਰਤ ਅੰਗ || ੲਿਕ ਪਾੲਿ ਠਾਢ ਅਭੰਗ ||੨੭੫||
transliteration: Nahiseet Maanat Ghaam|| Nahichit Lyaavat Chhaad|| Nahinaik Morat An|| Ik Paae Thaadh Abhan||275||
translation: He thought that this man was not caring for cold or hot weather and there is no desire of some shade in his mind he was standing on one foot without even slightly turning his limbs.275.

gurmukhi: ਢਿਗ ਦੱਤ ਤਾਂ ਕੇ ਜਾੲਿ || ਅਵਿਲੋਕ ਤਾਸ ਬਿਨਾੲਿ || ਅਧ ਰਾਤ੍ਰ ਨਿਰਜਨ ਤ੍ਰਾਸ || ਅਸ ਲੀਨ ਠਾਂਢ ੳੁਦਾਸ ||੨੭੬||
transliteration: Dhig Datt Taan Ke Jaae|| Avilok Taas Binaae|| Adh Raatra Nirjan Traas|| As Leen Thaandh Udaas||276||
translation: Dutt went near him and looked down upon him, learning. a bit; he was standing detachedly in that desolate atmosphere at midnighgt.276.

gurmukhi: ਬਰਖੰਤ ਮੇਘ ਮਹਾਨ || ਭੀਜੰਤ ਭੂਮ ਨਿਧਾਨ || ਜਗਿ ਜੀਵ ਸਰਬ ਸੁਬਾਸ || ੳੁਠ ਭਾਜ ਤ੍ਰਾਸ ੳਦਾਸ ||੨੭੭||
transliteration: Barkhanndmegh Mahaan|| Bheejant Bhoom Nidhaan|| Jag(i) Jeev Sarab Soubaas|| Outh Bhaaj Traas Udaas||277||
translation: It was raining and the water was spreading on the earth; all the beings of the world ran away in fear.277.

gurmukhi: ੲਿਹ ਠਾਢ ਭੂਪਤ ਪੳੁਰ || ਮਨ ਜਾਪ ਜਾਪਤ ਗੳੁਰ || ਨਹੀ ਨੈਕ ਮੋਰਤ ਅੰਗ || ੲਿਕ ਪਾਨ ਠਾਢ ਅਭੰਗ ||੨੭੮||
transliteration: Eh Thaadh Bhoopat Paur|| Man Jaap Jaapat Gaddd|| Nahinaik Morat An|| Ik Paan Thaadh Abhan||278||
translation: This orderly was standing at the gate of the king like this and was repeating the name of the goddess Gauri-Parvati in his mind; he was standing on one foot, without even slightly turning his limbs.278.

gurmukhi: ਅਸ ਲੀਨ ਪਾਨ ਕਰਾਲ || ਚਮਕੰਤ ੳੁੱਜਲ ਜ੍ਵਾਲ || ਜਨ ਕਾਹੂ ਕੋ ਨਹੀ ਮਿਤ੍ਰ || ੲਿਹ ਭਾਂਤਿ ਪਰਮ ਪਵਿਤ੍ਰ ||੨੭੯||
transliteration: As Leen Paan Karaal|| Chamkant Ujjal Jvaal|| Jan Kaahoo Ko Nahimitra|| Eh Bhaant(i) Param Pavitra||279||
translation: A dreadful sword was shining in his hand like a flame of fire and he was standing solemnly without seeming to have friendliness for anyone.279.

gurmukhi: ਨਹੀ ਨੈਕ ੳੁਚਾਵਤ ਪਾੳੁ || ਬਹੁ ਭਾਤ ਸਾਧਤ ਦਾੳੁ || ਅਨਯਾਸ ਭੂਪਤ ਭਗਤ || ਪ੍ਰਭ ੲੇਕ ਹੀ ਰਸ ਪਗਤ ||੨੮੦||
transliteration: Nahinaik Ouchaavadpaau|| Bahu Bhaat Saadhat Daau|| Anuaas Bhoopat Bhagad|| Prabh Ek Hiras Pagad||280||
translation: He was not even raising his foot slightly and he was in the posture of playing trick in many ways; he was a devotee of the king dyed unswervingly in the love of the Lord.280.

gurmukhi: ਜਲ ਪਰਤ ਮੂਸਲ ਧਾਰ || ਗ੍ਹਿ ਲੇਨ ਓਟ ਦੁਅਾਰ || ਪਸੁ ਪੱਛ ਸਰਬ ਦਿਸਾਨ || ਸਭ ਦੇਸ ਦੇਸ ਸਿਧਾਨ ||੨੮੧||
transliteration: Jal Parat Moondal Dhaar|| Grah(i) Len Ot Duaar|| Pas(u) Pachchh Sarab Desaan|| Sabh Des Des Sidhaan||281||
translation: Because of heavy rain, all the animals and birds were going from various directions to their homes in order to take shelter.281.

gurmukhi: ੲਿਹ ਠਾਢ ਹੈ ੲਿਕ ਅਾਸ || ੲਿਕ ਪਾਨ ਜਾਨ ੳੁਦਾਸ || ਅਸ ਲੀਨ ਪਾਨ ਪ੍ਰਚੰਡ || ਅਤਿ ਤੇਜਵੰਤ ਅਖੰਡ ||੨੮੨||
transliteration: Eh Thaadh Hai Ik Aas|| Ik Paan Jaan Udaas|| As Leen Paan Prachanndd|| At(i) Tejvant Adhand||282||
translation: He was standing detachedly on one foot and taking his sword in one of his hands, he was looking extremely lustrous.282.

gurmukhi: ਮਨ ਅਾਨ ਕੋ ਨਹੀ ਭਾਵ || ੲਿਕ ਦੇਵ ਕੋ ਚਿਤ ਚਾਵ || ੲਿਕ ਪਾਵ ਅੈਸੇ ਠਾਢ || ਰਨ ਖੰਡ ਜਾਨੁਕ ਗਾਡ ||੨੮੩||
transliteration: Man Aan Ko Nahibhaav|| Ik Dev Ko Chit Chaav|| Ik Paav Aise Thaadh|| Ran Khanbh Jaanouk Gadd||283||
translation: There was no other idea in his mind except his master and he was standing on one foot like a column standing in the battlefield.283.

gurmukhi: ਜਿਹ ਭੂਮ ਧਾਰਸ ਪਾਵ || ਨਹੀ ਨੈਕ ਫੇਰ ੳੁਚਾਵ || ਨਹੀ ਠਾਮ ਭੀਜਸ ਤੳੁਨ || ਅਵਿਲੋਕ ਭੲਿਓ ਮੁਨਿ ਮੳੁਨ ||੨੮੪||
transliteration: Jih Bhoom Dhaaras Paav|| Nahinaik Pher Ouchaav|| Nahithaam Bheejas Taoun|| Avilok Bhaio Mounndi) Maoun||284||
translation: Wherever he placed his foot, he firmly fixed it there; at his place, he was not getting wet and seeing him the sage Dutt kept silent.284.

gurmukhi: ਅਵਿਲੋਕ ਤਾਸ ਮੁਨੇਸ || ਅਕਲੰਕ ਭਾਗ ਵਿਭੇਸ || ਗੁਰ ਜਾਨ ਪਰੀਅਾ ਪਾੲਿ || ਤਜਿ ਲਾਜ ਸਾਜ ਸਚਾੲਿ ||੨੮੫||
transliteration: Anilok Taas Mounnds|| Akalank Bhaag Vibhes|| Gur Jaan Pariaa Paae|| Taj(i) Laaj Saaj Sachaae||285||
translation: The sage saw him and he seemed to him like a part of a blemishless moon; the sage abandoning his shyness and accepting him as his Guru, fell at his feet.285.

gurmukhi: ਤਿਹ ਜਾਨ ਕੈ ਗੁਰਦੇਵ || ਅਕਲੰਕ ਦੱਤ ਅਭੇਵ || ਚਿਤ ਤਾਸ ਕੇ ਰਸ ਭੀਨ || ਗੁਰ ਤ੍ਰੳੁਦਸਮੋ ਤਿਹ ਕੀਨ ||੨੮੬||
transliteration: Tih Jaan Kai Gurdev|| Akalank Darr Abhev|| Chit Taas K Eras Bheen|| Gur Traudasmo Tih Keen||286||
translation: The blemishless Dutt, accepting him as his Guru, absorbed his mind in his love and in this way adopted him as the Thirteenth Guru.286.
